thread.title: Houston man caught on video beating 7-year-old boy 62 times, officials say | Crime | Dallas News
thread.title_full: Houston man caught on video beating 7-year-old boy 62 times, officials say | Crime | Dallas News

title: Houston man caught on video beating 7-year-old boy 62 times, officials say | Crime | Dallas News
text:
Houston man caught on video beating 7-year-old boy 62 times, officials say Filed under Crime at Get Daily Dallas News Headlines Sign Up Get Unlimited Digital Access Your first month is less than a dollar. $0.99 for first 4 weeks Subscribe Now 
A Houston-area man is accused of hitting his girlfriend's young son 62 times within 5 minutes Thursday. 
A Harris County Precinct 1 deputy who was monitoring cameras set up to catch illegal dumping saw the man pull up at the site near the man's apartment, get out of the car and proceed to beat the 7-year-old boy, KTRK-TV reported . 
"This guy ravaged this kid, he was hit 62 times, we counted," Constable Alan Rosen told KTRK. "He was bent over the hood of a car and hit with a belt. It's just an extremely sad situation." 
Deputies arrested 27-year-old Kordarell Demond Williams a few hours later, using his license plate to track him down, KPRC 2 reported . 
In the video, Williams is seen hitting the boy with a belt and at times his hands, continuing even when the boy was on the ground. 
The boy was taken to an area hospital. He had bruising on both eyes and neck, a swollen right eye and welts all over his body, a prosecutor told KPRC. 
Williams appeared in court on Friday and did not deny beating the boy, who is his girlfriend's son. He said he hit the child 16 times for stealing a phone charger, KPRC reported. 
Williams is in a Harris County jail on a charge of injury to a child under 15. Bail has been set at $30,000. View Comments
